tit.cmt: (record of the history of the Takahashi clan) を追記しました。

sen.j: 高橋氏文（たかはしうじぶみ）は、日本の歴史書、古記録である。
sen.e: Takahashi Ujibumi (histories compiled by the Takahashi family) was a history book, a collection of records, in ancient Japan.
Takahashi Ujibumi (histories compiled by the Takahashi family) was a history book, a collection of records, in ancient Japan.
"Takahashi Ujibumi" (histories compiled by the Takahashi family) is a history book, a collection of records, in ancient Japan.
sen.cmt: Takahashi Ujibumi にダブルコーテーションを追記しました。was を is に修正しました。

sen.j: 宮内省内膳司に仕えた高橋氏が安曇氏と勢力争いしたときに、古来の伝承を朝廷に奏上した延暦8年の家記。
sen.e: During power struggle with the Azumi family, the Takahashi family, who served at the Naizenshi (Imperial Table Office) of the Imperial Court, compiled oral traditions and presented it to the Imperial Court as the record of family in 789.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: During a power struggle with the Azumi family the Takahashi family, who served at the Naizenshi (Imperial Table Office) of the Imperial Court, compiled oral traditions and presented it to the Imperial Court as the record of family in 789.

During a power struggle with the Azumi clan, the Takahashi clan, who served at the Naizenshi (Imperial Table Office) of the Ministry of the Sovereign's Household, compiled oral traditions and presented it to the Imperial Court as the record of family in 789.
sen.cmt: family を clan に修正しました。宮内省the Imperial Court をthe Ministry of the Sovereign's Household に修正しました。

sen.j: これに関する延暦11年の太政官符。
sen.e: In 792, Takahashi Ujibumi was release as Daijokanpu (official documents issued by Daijokan, Grand Council of State).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 792, Takahashi Ujibumi was release as Daijokanpu (official documents issued by Daijokan, Grand Council of State).
In 792, Takahashi Ujibumi was released as Daijokanpu (official documents issued by Daijokan, Grand Council of State).
sen.cmt: release を released に修正しました。

sen.j: 残念ながら完本は伝わておらず、逸文が『本朝月令』、『政事要略』、『年中行事秘抄』その他に見える。
sen.e: Unfortunately, the complete book was not preserved, but copies of original sentences can be found in "Honcho Gatsuryo" (Records of annual events and their origins), "Seiji Yoryaku" (Brief Outline of Government), "Nenju Gyoji Hisho" (Secret records of annual events) and so on.

Unfortunately, the complete book was not preserved, but copies of original sentences can be found in "Honcho Gatsuryo" (Records of annual events and their origins), "Seiji Yoryaku" (Brief Outline of Government), "Nenju Gyoji Hisho" (Secret records of annual events) and so on.

Unfortunately, the complete book was not preserved, but copies of original sentences can be found in "Honcho Gatsuryo" (Records of annual events and their origins), "Seiji Yoryaku" (Brief Outline of Government), "Nenju Gyoji Hisho" (Secret records of annual events) and so on.
